byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: M. E. Springer has been appointed assistant vice president of American News Company, Inc., in charge of the stationery department. He joined the company thirty-eight years ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: M. E. Springer has been appointed assistant vice president of American News Company, Inc., in charge of the stationery department. He joined the company thirty-eight years ago.

headline.main: BUSINESS NOTES; U. S. Rubber Co. Names Assistant to President

docs.snippet: The one bright spot in the foreign exchange market last week was the action of the Canadian free dollar continuing its strength and reaching a new high of 93.82 cents, unmatched since June 21, 1948.
docs.lead_paragraph: The one bright spot in the foreign exchange market last week was the action of the Canadian free dollar continuing its strength and reaching a new high of 93.82 cents, unmatched since June 21, 1948.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week ended March 11, 1949

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 14 -- France and Canada squared their World War II accounts with the United States today. The bilateral agreements were signed at the State Department by Secretary Dean Acheson and Ambassadors Henri Bonnet and Hume Wrong for their...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 14 -- France and Canada squared their World War II accounts with the United States today. The bilateral agreements were signed at the State Department by Secretary Dean Acheson and Ambassadors Henri Bonnet and Hume Wrong for their respective governments.

headline.main: PARIS AND OTTAWA MEET U.S. WAR BILLS; France to Pay $653,300,000 in Settling Accounts, While Canada Gets $3,675,000

byline.original: By HAROLD B. HINTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The backlog of Latin-American draft collection items sent out for payment but not yet paid increased $6,000,000 during February, according to the collection experience of twelve New York City banks, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported...
docs.lead_paragraph: The backlog of Latin-American draft collection items sent out for payment but not yet paid increased $6,000,000 during February, according to the collection experience of twelve New York City banks, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

headline.main: UNPAID DRAFTS UP IN LATIN AMERICA; Backlog of Collections Rose $6,000,000 in February -- Items Covered Set Low Mark

docs.snippet: Three of the nine games in the first round of the international chess masters tournament, now under way in the Gran Casino's Auditorium at Mar del Plata, resulted in decisive victories, according to a report received from Argentina yesterday. Two...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three of the nine games in the first round of the international chess masters tournament, now under way in the Gran Casino's Auditorium at Mar del Plata, resulted in decisive victories, according to a report received from Argentina yesterday. Two matches were drawn and four adjourned.

headline.main: CZERNIAK IS VICTOR IN ARGENTINE CHESS; Guimard, Cabral Also Gain -Lasker Match Adjourned After Forty Moves

docs.snippet: Miguel Czerniak of Palestine, Rodrigo Flores of Chile and Marcos Luckis of Lithuania topped the standing of the eighteen competitors after two rounds of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Miguel Czerniak of Palestine, Rodrigo Flores of Chile and Marcos Luckis of Lithuania topped the standing of the eighteen competitors after two rounds of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from Argentina, yesterday.

headline.main: LUCKIS TURNS BACK POMAR IN 37 MOVES; Ties Flores and Czerniak for Chess Lead in Argentina -- Lasker Held to Draw

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 18 -- Five exporting and forty-one importing nations today agreed upon a wheat treaty that will cover 450,000,000 bushels annually for four years and will not include Soviet Russia.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 18 -- Five exporting and forty-one importing nations today agreed upon a wheat treaty that will cover 450,000,000 bushels annually for four years and will not include Soviet Russia.
docs.abstract: J C Van Essche repts progress; USSR quits conf; stays as observer

headline.main: 46 Nations Agree on a 4-Year Wheat Treaty; Soviet Quits Over Size of Export Allocation

byline.original: By BESS FURMANSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Dr. Edward Lasker of New York was among the winners in the fourth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina yesterday. His opponent was Cesar J. Corte of Buenos Aires, who adopted the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Edward Lasker of New York was among the winners in the fourth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina yesterday. His opponent was Cesar J. Corte of Buenos Aires, who adopted the Nimzowitsch defense against the Queen's Gambit played by the United States representative.

headline.main: LASKER TRIUMPHS AFTER 40TH MOVE; Takes Fourth-Round Game in Argentine Chess as Corte Oversteps Time Limit

docs.snippet: ex-Pres Gallegos urges Uruguay to call attention to plight of regime's pol prisoners
